category_summary:
A light day for AI content, with only one substantive AI-related post in the feed.

- **Ethan Mollick** continues his 'AI game demo a day' experiment, [showcasing a satirical game](/?date=2026-01-18&category=social#item-01cd1b7d34c9) where players prevent apocalypse by managing Jira tickets—highlighting AI's creative prototyping capabilities

**Simon Willison** [shared an off-topic thread](/?date=2026-01-18&category=social#item-d559c3018a33) celebrating **LaRussell's** community music collaborations with Bay Area high schools, unrelated to AI/ML developments.
category_summary_html:
A light day for AI content, with only one substantive AI-related post in the feed.

  • Ethan Mollick continues his 'AI game demo a day' experiment, showcasing a satirical game where players prevent apocalypse by managing Jira tickets—highlighting AI's creative prototyping capabilities

Simon Willison shared an off-topic thread celebrating LaRussell's community music collaborations with Bay Area high schools, unrelated to AI/ML developments.

items.title: Continuing to have AI build a weird game demo a day. Here is: "Make a game where you have to prevent...
items.content:
Continuing to have AI build a weird game demo a day. Here is: "Make a game where you have to prevent the apocalypse, but the interface is just Jira tickets"

Pretty fun/funny branching storyline, all text is AI created with minor feedback from me. Play: gentle-bienenstitch-01e24b.netlify.app
items.author: @emollick.bsky.social
items.summary: Continuing our coverage from [yesterday](/?date=2026-01-17&category=social#item-85d3dfe3a93b), Ethan Mollick shares his ongoing 'AI game demo a day' experiment - a satirical game where players prevent the apocalypse by managing Jira tickets. All game text is AI-generated with minimal human feedback, hosted as a playable demo.
items.reasoning: Ethan Mollick is a highly credible AI researcher/Wharton professor known for practical AI experimentation. Solid engagement (105 likes). Demonstrates creative AI-assisted development workflows and rapid prototyping capabilities. Not technically deep but shows practical generative AI applications.

continuation.original_title: "Claude Code, make me a version of the 1984 abandonware Apple IIe game Rescue Raiders, look it up"

items.summary_html: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Ethan Mollick shares his ongoing 'AI game demo a day' experiment - a satirical game where players prevent the apocalypse by managing Jira tickets. All game text is AI-generated with minimal human feedback, hosted as a playable demo.
items.content_html:
Continuing to have AI build a weird game demo a day. Here is: "Make a game where you have to prevent the apocalypse, but the interface is just Jira tickets"

Pretty fun/funny branching storyline, all text is AI created with minor feedback from me. Play: gentle-bienenstitch-01e24b.netlify.app
